meanings.sent1: She unquotes the text to make it easier to read.
meanings.sent2: The teacher unquotes the passage to show the original wording.
meanings.sent3: After she unquotes the paragraph, it looks much cleaner.
meanings.sent4: He unquotes the dialogue, revealing the true meaning behind the words.
meanings.sent5: The editor unquotes the document, making it more professional.

meanings.definition: To stop quoting someone or something
meanings.sent1: Please unquotes the author now and share your own thoughts.
meanings.sent2: The journalist unquotes the interviewee before adding their analysis.
meanings.sent3: He unquotes his friend to avoid any misinterpretation.
meanings.sent4: She unquotes the expert, ready to present her own ideas.
meanings.sent5: The student unquotes the source, preparing to discuss the topic.

meanings.definition: To indicate the end of a quotation
meanings.sent1: The punctuation mark unquotes the dialogue in the story.
meanings.sent2: The closing quotation mark unquotes the character's speech.
meanings.sent3: The period unquotes the sentence, marking the end of the quote.
meanings.sent4: The comma unquotes the phrase, signaling the completion of the citation.
meanings.sent5: The ellipsis unquotes the text, leaving room for interpretation.
